channel.title: Is it possible?
channel.description: Is it possible to make another javafile or a new class file That is just for commands then you can import it into the client.java? would be alot easyer for orginization ;)

item.title: Is it possible?

item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

rcscape:

and i have no idea how to do that anybody want to add me on msn and be my mentor? i could possibly help you with any pascal problems you may have X)

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/

Learn.

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“Mopar Is ze best, post:3, topic:338746”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=435134.msg3195603#msg3195603 date=1272760462]

Is it possible to make another javafile or a new class file That is just for commands then you can import it into the client.java? would be alot easyer for orginization

Yes, and it’s been done many times. It would take about 5 minutes or less to make.
[/quote]

Couldn’t you just make a class and then import it into the client.java file? Although, you would have to get the commands into the void that has the commands in it.[/quote]

The best way would be to create a static class with a commands method and just call that class from the command method in the client class.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Mopar_Is_ze_best Mopar Is ze best
item.description:
@Mopar_Is_ze_best wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:2, topic:338746”][quote author=rcscape link=topic=435134.msg3195601#msg3195601 date=1272760424]
Is it possible to make another javafile or a new class file That is just for commands then you can import it into the client.java? would be alot easyer for orginization
[/quote]
Yes, and it’s been done many times. It would take about 5 minutes or less to make.[/quote]

Couldn’t you just make a class and then import it into the client.java file? Although, you would have to get the commands into the void that has the commands in it.

Read full topic
